Material used.Description: Transgenic Drosophila overexpressing human LRRK2 G2019S, Y1699C, or G2385R variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of G2019S mutant leads to significant degeneration of DA neurons in the PPM clusters 1 and 3, locomotion deficits, and increased sensitivity to rotenone.
Expression of Y1699C mutant leads to significant degeneration of DA neurons in the PPM clusters 1 and 3, but not significant locomotion deficits.
Expression of G2385R mutant leads to significant degeneration of DA neurons in the PPM clusters 1 and 3, similar to G2019S.

Biological replicates.Description: Flies expressing different LRRK2 variants were used as biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Multiple trials were performed for climbing assays and rotenone treatments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing flies were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Control flies without transgenes were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Studentâ€™s t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No significant loss of DA neurons or locomotion deficits.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant loss of DA neurons or locomotion deficits.
